location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Acting Resident at Bushire to William Newnham, Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is acknowledging the commands of the Bombay Government dated 8 March 1811, which requested that William Bruce provide an estimate for when he expects the warehouse to be cleared of the remaining European goods. In response, it states that in the opinion of the Acting Resident the current market does not offer much prospect of selling the remaining woollens.
